wikipedia_page.main: John Michael Russell was a British rower who competed in the 1960 Summer Olympics and the 1964 Summer Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Rowing at the 1964 Summer Olympics – Men's coxless four
response: |John RussellHugh Wardell-YerburghWilliam BarryJohn James
|1959||	John Russell	||London Rowing Club||	22.37	||	Putney to Mortlake

Hugh Arthur Wardell-Yerburgh (11 January 1938 – 28 January 1970) was a British rower. He won a silver medal in the coxless fours event at the 1964 Summer Olympics, together with John Russell, William Barry and John James.
In 1964 he was a crew member of the British boat which won the silver medal in the coxless fours event with John Russell, Hugh Wardell-Yerburgh, and William Barry.
